rComments: Very chill & understanding prof. Go 2 lecture cuz she gives hints bout what will be on the midterm & exam (She gave us hints for 6 out of the 7 exam questions, so u should def go). I didnt do the readings & still got an A+, but if u dont understand a concept do the reading or ask her as she is very helpful. If she repeats a concept a lot: STUDY IT!

definitely one of my favorite profs at UTM. The lecture content was a little boring but she always encouraged her students to participate in discussions which I found really helped me. She was also very accommodating when it comes to remarking.
There is a huge project that's worth 30% at the end of the course. Dr. Simalchik's lectures have amazing content but her delivery is a bit dry.

I learned so much from this course and Joan was kind and understanding all the time. Her lectures were a little boring at times, but it was also a 9am class so she was doing her best to keep the energy up! I really felt that her assignments helped me to understand gender issues. However, I'll caution that her tests are harder than they sound!
She is an amazing professor. Taught my favour class. Would definitely recommend if you want to learn and be more aware of the society around you.

she goes through lecture slides too fast and repeats many ideas over and over again. Her voice is so monotoned I fall asleep in her class. she needs to post the slides on time. only thing I like about this class is, that if I skip a class, I won't miss much since most things are repeated or in the textbook.

I've had the privilege of having Joan several times for various courses, I actually sought her out when selecting courses. Joan is inspirational, she was the ONLY professor that stated "you are not just knowledge consumers, you are knowledge producers"; she inspired us by reminding us of our agency as scholars, not just students. Great mentor!

Professor Simalchik is a good professor. I believe she succeeded at making me memorize the term "intersectionality" and "power, context and agency". She repeats herself a lot. Lectures from day one have been repeated many times and materials are usually similar. I recommend taking her class but don't skip the lecture or class participation.

Good prof. Pretty easy course. Her midterm/exam MC questions are mostly I-clicker questions, so if you come to class, you'll succeed. She is also a fairly easy marker. However, with some slides, she moves really fast, whereas others, she repeats what's already been said. Also, videos shown in class are boring. Don't skip. She does NOT post slides.

Professor Joan Simalchik is in all honesty the best professor I have had in my entire university career. She is very knowledgeable historian and very passionate about promoting  fighting for justice locally and internationally. Dr. Simalchik is helpful, fair and approachable. I would not miss a single lecture if I was dying, she's just THAT amazing

She is honestly one of the best professors i have had in my four years at university. She has so much knowledge about what she teachers. Moreover, she is really understanding and helpful.She was also amazing at helping me walk through what i could do with my degree. Very passionate and awesome lecturer. She makes what she teach interesting!

Lecture were very interesting as she talks about stories and shows videos.Interactive as we did an arpillera which was a free 10% participation of workshops of just sitting there. Readings mostly online & a few articles in course reader. Some readings are really boring and long. Exam was easy, mostly lecture notes & memorize iClicker questions!
AMAZING professor !!!!

her lectures are mandatory but are interesting, since she often plays videos and gives stories. tests were fair if you studied and listened in class. sometimes she seemed a little technologically clueless (didn't know how to use iclickers/start up powerpoint) but she was nice :)

Prof was pretty well informed. She needs to learn to slow down in lectures and post lecture slides- really her ideas are not so original she has to worry about coyright issues!Not well coordinated with large classes as she tends to be inefficient.Very much an academic feminist, not an activist feminist

Joan Simalchik is an exceptional professor! She is easy to approach with questions after class, or during office hours. She is eager to aid students in the direction necessary for them to pass her class and start to really understand and connect with the material. Before taking her classes, I had no direction in life, now I do, thanks to her help:)

Joan Simalchik is an exceptional professor! She is easy to approach with questions after class, or during office hours. She is eager to aid students in the direction necessary for them to pass her class and start to really understand and connect with the material. Before taking her classes, I had no direction in life, now I do, thanks to her help:)
Very understandable and fabulous teachers at UTM...I was privileged to be in her class
She is an amazing professor, knows what she's talking about and is really full of knowledge! I love listening to her lectures because she is soooo insightful. Best class to take!!

Phenomenal Prof; she will open your mind and get you to think in ways your brain has never experienced. This class was not easy at all, you really have to work hard for each mark and you can't fool a woman as smart as she is. After this class, my friend and I now have a saying: "we've been Simalchik-ed!" Take the class then you'll know what I mean.

Loved her classes! Especially Immigrant and Refugee Women. I learned so much! Not only does she teach about immigrants and refugees but she's also helped them in the past so she know's what she's talking about! Great Prof with awesome field trips!
